bridgeBurn(uint256,uint256,bytes32,addre.details: In case of native token vault _data is the tuple of _depositAmount and _l2Receiver.

params._assetId: the assetId of the asset being bridged
params._chainId: the chainId that the message will be sent to
params._data: the actual data specified for the function
params._msgValue: the msg.value of the L2 transaction. For now it is always 0.

returns._bridgeMintData: The calldata used by counterpart asset handler to unlock tokens for recipient.

bridgeMint(uint256,bytes32,bytes).details: Note, that while payable, this function will only receive base token on L2 chains, while L1 the provided msg.value is always 0. However, this may change in the future, so if your AssetHandler implementation relies on it, it is better to explicitly check it.

params._assetId: the assetId of the asset being bridged
params._chainId: the chainId that the message is from
params._data: the actual data specified for the function

migrationPaused().details: Denotes whether the migrations of chains is paused.

bridgeBurn(uint256,uint256,bytes32,addre.notice: Burns bridged tokens and returns the calldata for L2 <-> L1 message.

documentation.text: @dev Denotes whether the migrations of chains is paused.
